intro: Aegialophila pumilio, commonly known as the dwarf lantana, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically produces small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to purple, depending on the species. It thrives in coastal and sandy soils, often found in dune environments. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes used in landscaping for its ornamental value and ability to stabilize soil.
